ImageStoreProxy * mpImageStoreProxy

Detailed Description

Image content provider.

The Image provider contains meta data for all available image on both internal and external storage devices.

The following example demonstrates how to use this ImageStore class.

 addImage() {
     // Add an image
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     ImageStore* imageStore = new ImageStore(*context);
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();

     cv->addValue(ImageStore::DATA(), filePath);
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::TITLE(), imageName);
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::DISPLAY_NAME(), imageName);
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::DESCRIPTION(), description);
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::DATE_TAKEN(), dateTaken);
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::MIME_TYPE(), mimeType);
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::ORIENTATION(), orientation);

     imageStore->add(ImageStore::IMAGE_URI(ImageStore::INTERNAL), *cv);

     delete context;
     delete imageStore;
     delete cv;
 }

 showEditAndDeleteImage() {
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     ImageStore* imageStore = new ImageStore(*context);
     StringArray selection (3);
     selection.replaceAt(ImageStore::ID(), 0);
     selection.replaceAt(ImageStore::DATA(), 1);
     selection.replaceAt(ImageStore::DESCRIPTION(), 2);

     // Show images
     Cursor* images = imageStore->getN(ImageStore::IMAGE_URI(ImageStore::INTERNAL),
         &selection, NULL, NULL, &ImageStore::IMAGE_ORDER());

     if (images != NULL && images->getCount() > 0) {
         images->moveToFirst();
         do {
             int64_t id = images->getLong(0);
             String data = images->getString(1);
             String description = images->getString(2);

             // ...
         } while (images->moveToNext());
     }
     // Close the cursor
     images->close();

     // Edit an image
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();
     cv->addValue(ImageStore::DESCRIPTION(), newDescription);

     Uri uri1 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(ImageStore::IMAGE_URI(ImageStore::INTERNAL), updateId);
     imageStore->set(uri1, *cv, NULL, NULL);

     // Delete an image
     Uri uri2 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(ImageStore::IMAGE_URI(ImageStore::INTERNAL), deleteId);
     imageStore->remove(uri2, NULL, NULL);

     delete context;
     delete imageStore;
     delete cv;
 }

See the sample given above. There are four operations about ImageStore: add, edit, show and remove.

enum gaia::content::ImageStore::StorageType

Storage Type.

Enumerator:
INTERNAL 

The internal storage.

The primary external storage.

void gaia::content::ImageStore::cancelThumbnailRequest ( int64_t  origId)

This method cancels the thumbnail request so clients waiting for getThumbnail will be interrupted and return immediately.

Only the original process which made the getThumbnail requests can cancel their own requests.

Parameters:
origIdoriginal image id.

static base::String gaia::content::ImageStore::DATE_ADDED ( ) [static]

The time the file was added to the media provider.

Units are seconds since 1970.

static base::String gaia::content::ImageStore::DATE_MODIFIED ( ) [static]

The time the file was last modified.

Units are seconds since 1970. NOTE: This is for internal use by the media scanner. Do not modify this field.

Type: INTEGER (int64_t)

graphics::Bitmap* gaia::content::ImageStore::getBitmapN ( const net::Uri &  url)

Retrieves an image for the given url as a Bitmap.

Parameters:
urlThe url of the image.
Returns:
A bitmap instance of the given url.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::ImageStore::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

graphics::Bitmap* gaia::content::ImageStore::getThumbnailN ( int64_t  origId,
int32_t  kind,
const graphics::BitmapFactory::Options &  options 
)

This method checks if the thumbnails of the specified image (origId) has been created.

It will be blocked until the thumbnails are generated.

Parameters:
origIdOriginal image id associated with thumbnail of interest.
kindThe type of thumbnail to fetch. Should be either MINI_KIND = 1 or MICRO_KIND = 3.
optionsThis is only used for MINI_KIND when decoding the Bitmap.
Returns:
A Bitmap instance. It could be null if the original image associated with origId doesn't exist or memory is not enough.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

int32_t gaia::content::ImageStore::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
